channel.title: CVE Feed for mySCADA -- myPRO
channel.description: The latest CVEs for mySCADA -- myPRO

item.title: CVE-2021-22657|2024-09-17T00:21:11.417Z -- myscada -- mypro
item.description: mySCADA myPRO: Versions 8.20.0 and prior has a feature where the API password can be specified, which may allow an attacker to inject arbitrary operating system commands through a specific parameter.

item.title: CVE-2021-33005|2024-09-17T00:32:14.543Z -- myscada -- mypro
item.description: mySCADA myPRO versions prior to 8.20.0 allows an unauthenticated remote attacker to upload arbitrary files to arbitrary directories.

item.title: CVE-2021-44453|2024-09-17T01:46:17.937Z -- myscada -- mypro
item.description: mySCADA myPRO: Versions 8.20.0 and prior has a vulnerable debug interface which includes a ping utility, which may allow an attacker to inject arbitrary operating system commands.

item.title: CVE-2024-4708|2024-08-01T20:47:41.657Z -- myscada -- mypro
item.description:
mySCADA myPRO
uses a hard-coded password which could allow an attacker to remotely execute code on the affected device.

item.title: CVE-2024-4708|2024-07-05T21:23:04.236Z -- myscada -- mypro
item.description:
mySCADA myPRO
uses a hard-coded password which could allow an attacker to remotely execute code on the affected device.

item.title: CVE-2024-4708|2024-07-23T20:56:09.695Z -- myscada -- mypro
item.description:
mySCADA myPRO
uses a hard-coded password which could allow an attacker to remotely execute code on the affected device.
